intro: Pavonia novozelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand wood rose, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in coastal and forested areas, often found in the northern regions of the country. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
